questions.question: British codebreaking machine used during World War II.
questions.explanation: Colossus was used at Bletchley Park to decrypt German messages.

questions.question: Alan Turing's theoretical computing machine concept.
questions.explanation: The Turing Machine is a theoretical model of computation.

questions.question: First Apple computer with a graphical user interface.
questions.explanation: The Macintosh popularized GUI in personal computers in 1984.

questions.question: Research facility where the transistor was invented.
questions.explanation: Bell Labs invented the transistor in 1947.

questions.question: Computer that defeated chess world champion Garry Kasparov.
questions.explanation: IBM's Deep Blue defeated Kasparov in 1997.

questions.question: First integrated circuit component used in third generation computers.
questions.explanation: ICs combined multiple transistors on a single chip.

questions.question: Computer language developed for teaching programming.
questions.explanation: BASIC was designed for beginners in the 1960s.

questions.question: First portable computer released in 1981.
questions.explanation: The Osborne 1 was the first commercially successful portable computer.

questions.question: Protocol suite that became the foundation of the Internet.
questions.explanation: TCP/IP was developed in the 1970s for ARPANET.

questions.question: Company that created the first smartphone.
questions.explanation: IBM's Simon was the first smartphone, released in 1994.
